medical_history.chief_complaint: Sub-acute onset of gait ataxia, dysphagia, and dysarthria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced worsening stepping gait for the previous decade. Initial symptoms began one year and a half before presentation, marked by an EMG examination that showed a demyelinating sensorimotor neuropathy. Symptoms progressively worsened.
medical_history.past_medical_history: X-linked Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT1X), chronic progressive-relapsing inflammatory demyelinating CNS disease. One previous EMG showed demyelinating sensorimotor neuropathy.
medical_history.family_history: A brother showed stepping gait with bilateral severe deficit of ankle dorsiflexion and a mixed sensorimotor polyneuropathy. Genetic analysis confirmed the same mutation of the GJB1 gene.
